column1: Comparison of narrow type with wide type in loop condition
column2: Comparisons between types of different widths in a loop condition can cause the loop to behave unexpectedly.
column4: Comparison between [["index"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/mesh/access.c:457:11:457:15"]] of type uint16_t and [["elem_count"|"relative:///include/bluetooth/mesh/access.h:650:9:650:18"]] of wider type size_t.

column2: An initialization function is used to initialize a local variable, but the returned status code is not checked. The variable may be left in an uninitialized state, and reading the variable may result in undefined behavior.
column4: The status of this call to [["bt_mesh_va_del"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/mesh/transport.c:1722:9:1722:22"]] is not checked, potentially leaving [["sub_addr"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/mesh/cfg_srv.c:1454:22:1454:29"]] uninitialized.

column2: Implicit scaling of pointer arithmetic expressions can cause buffer overflow conditions.
column4: This pointer might have type [["bt_mesh_prov_link"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/mesh/prov.c:63:26:63:43"]] (size 292), but the pointer arithmetic here is done with type uint8_t * (size 1).
